name: Taco Dragon
description:
Taco Dragon is based on the conceit that Dragons Love Tacos, as detailed in the fantastic childrens' books by Adam Rubin and David Salmieri. I don't want to infringe on the copyright or intellectual property as a whole, but I really enjoy these books as do my sons, Stormy and Rocky (both under the age of 7).

In this initial iteration of the game, you control a small dragon collecting tacos.

In future, I intend to add enemies, a story, a big bad, etc., completely different from, but paying homage to, the books. Also intending to smooth out the controls, camera movement, etc.

 This is my fourth game (I think), and the current build you see was created in a day (yesterday) which I'll detail more of in my devblog.

CONTROLS:

Mouse controls the camera

Left+click - shoot fireball

Right+click - breathe fire

W - forward

S - backward

A - left

D - right

Spacebar - jump / gain altitude

Q - take flight / leave flight

F - pay respects

This is most definitely a pre-alpha, rough draft build of a game. 

It has a title screen, gameplay, a pause screen with options to resume, return to title, or quit outright, music, and some minimal sound effects.

I used premade assets extensively as I consider myself by far more of a designer/writer than coder.
